short_description: Discover the twin-island paradise of Antigua and Barbuda in the Caribbean. Experience 365 stunning beaches, crystal-clear waters, rich colonial history, vibrant culture, and world-class resorts in this tropical haven.

health.tap_water_safety: Generally safe, but bottled water is recommended
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, restaurants, and stores

tipping.hotels: Tipping is appreciated for porters ($1-2 per bag) and housekeeping ($2-5 per day)
tipping.guides: 10-15% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10-15% tip is customary for good service, though some restaurants may include a service charge
tipping.taxis: Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory, rounding up is common

weather.title: Antigua and Barbuda has a tropical climate with warm temperatures year-round. The dry season runs from December to April, while the wet season is from May to November, with the highest chance of hurricanes from August to October.

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Perfect weather with low humidity, minimal rainfall, and warm temperatures. This is the peak tourist season, ideal for beach activities, water sports, sailing, and outdoor adventures. Best time for diving and snorkeling

when_to_visit.title: Shoulder Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Warm temperatures with occasional brief showers. Fewer crowds and lower prices make this a great time to visit. Still excellent weather for beach activities, water sports, and exploring the islands

when_to_visit.title: Carnival Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Experience the vibrant Antigua Carnival with colorful parades, music, and cultural celebrations. Warm weather with some rain possible, but the festive atmosphere makes it a unique time to visit

when_to_visit.title: Wet Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Higher humidity and more frequent rain showers, with peak hurricane season in September and October. Lower prices and fewer tourists, but be aware of weather conditions

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Antigua and Barbuda is during the dry season from December to April when the weather is perfect with low humidity, minimal rainfall, and ideal conditions for beach activities, water sports, and outdoor adventures
